result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Bail/bond hearing on November 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Asst. District Attorney Kevin Greene appears on behalf of the State. Attorney Steven Daniel Johnson and Salvador Leon-Almanza appear in custody via Zoom. Defendant pleads not guilty to both counts. Present bond continued
Status conference scheduled for November 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Adjustment Number: 22A 026118,
Payable Number: 360440,
Receipt Number: 22R 035943,
Amount: $20.00

Defendant Salvador Leon-Almanza in court and in custody at the Brown County Jail.  Attorney Jeffrey Joseph Cano in court for Salvador Leon-Almanza.  Prosecuting attorney Caleb Saunders in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant/attorney waives right to Preliminary Hearing and files waiver form with Court.
Plea negotiations placed on the record.
Court accepts waiver and orders defendant bound over to assigned branch.
Information to be filed.
Bond continued.
Arraignment scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Salvador Leon-Almanza appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Jeffrey Joseph Cano appeared by video for Salvador Leon-Almanza.  Spanish interpreter appears on behalf of the defendant.
Prosecuting attorney Kari Hoffman appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Present bond continued
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 22, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Salvador Leon-Almanza in court, in custody at the Brown County Jail.  Prosecuting attorney Kevin L Steuck in court for the State of Wisconsin.

Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 13, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Court finds good cause to exceed time limits.
